contentrichtext.text: {{about|the Matthew Good Band album||underdog (disambiguation)}} {{Infobox Album <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = Underdogs | Type = [[Album]] | Artist = [[Matthew Good Band]] | Cover = Matthew_Good_Band_Underdogs.jpg | Released = October 7, 1997 (CAN)<br>August 25, 1998 (International) | Recorded = Greenhouse Studios, [[Burnaby, British Columbia]], [[Canada]] | Genre = [[Alternative rock]] | Length = 57:27 | Label = [[Mercury Records]], Darktown Records, [[PolyGram|Polygram Records]] | Producer = Warne Livesey | Last album = ''[[Raygun (EP)]]''<br>(1996) | This album = '''''Underdogs'''''<br/>(1997) | Next album = ''[[Lo-Fi B-Sides]] (EP)''<br>(1998) | Misc = {{Singles | Name = Underdogs | Type = Studio | single 1 = [[Everything Is Automatic]] | single 1 date = 1997 | single 2 = [[Indestructible (Matthew Good Band song)|Indestructible]] | single 2 date = 1997 | single 3 = [[Apparitions (song)|Apparitions]] | single 3 date = 1998 | single 4 = [[Rico (song)|Rico]] | single 4 date = 1998 }} }} {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[Allmusic]] | rev1Score = {{Rating|3|5}}<ref>{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r368040/review|pure_url=yes}}</ref> | rev2 = [[Sputnikmusic]] | rev2Score = {{Rating|4|5}}<ref>http://musicianforums.com/review/7270/Matthew-Good-Band-Underdogs/</ref> }} '''''Underdogs''''' is the second full-length [[album]] released by the [[Matthew Good Band]] in 1997, as a follow-up to the 1995 album ''[[Last of the Ghetto Astronauts]]''. The album was the band's most successful album yet, reaching platinum sales in Canada and being nominated for "Best Rock Album" at the [[Juno_Awards_of_1999#Best_Rock_Album|1999 Juno Awards]]. In a 2000 poll by music magazine ''[[Chart (magazine)|Chart]]'', ''Underdogs'' was voted the 18th Greatest Canadian album of all time.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chartattack.com/DAMN/2000/06/3002.cfm|title=Top 50 Canadian Albums Of All-Time (20 To 11)|publisher=''[[Chart (magazine)|Chart]]''|accessdate=2011-03-26|archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20001018170908/http://www.chartattack.com/DAMN/2000/06/3002.cfm|archivedate=2000-10-18 }}</ref> ==Track listing== All tracks written by Matthew Good and Dave Genn, except where noted. # "Deep Six" – 3:32 # "[[Everything Is Automatic]]" – 4:17 # "[[Apparitions (song)|Apparitions]]" – 5:11 # "My Out Of Style Is Coming Back" – 3:16 # "Strangest One of All" – 4:41 # "Middle Class Gangsters" – 5:37 # "[[Rico (song)|Rico]]" – 3:26 (Good, Genn, Lloyd, Browne) # "Prime Time Deliverance" – 5:33 (Good) # "The Inescapable Us" – 3:12 (Good) # "[[Indestructible (Matthew Good Band song)|Indestructible]]" – 3:24 # "Invasion 1" – 4:04 # "Look Happy, It's The End Of The World" – 3:47 # "Change Of Season" – 7:21 ==Personnel== *[[Matthew Good Band]] **[[Matthew Good]] - [[Singing|vocals]], [[guitar]], cover concept **[[Ian Browne (musician)|Ian Browne]] - [[Drum kit|drums]] **[[Geoff Lloyd (musician)|Geoff Lloyd]] - [[Bass Guitar]], **[[Dave Genn]] - [[Guitar]], [[Keyboard instrument|Keyboards]] ::<small>Note: [[Todd Kerns]] performs backing vocals on "Everything Is Automatic" and "Rico" (not part of MGB)</small> *Warne Livesey - Producer, Engineer, mixer *Frank Weipert - Manager *Dean Maher - Assistant *Zach Blackstone - Engineer *Stephen Marcussen (Precision Mastering, [[Los Angeles, California|Los Angeles]], [[California|CA]]) - Mastering *Legal: Jonathan Simkin *Accounting: Davidson & Co. *Don C. Tyler - Digital editor *Leanne Petersen - Cover [[Photography|photos]] *Andrea Marouk - Additional photos *Garnet Armstrong - Album design *Manufacturer: [[Darktown Records]] *Distributor: [[A&M Records]], a division of [[PolyGram]] Inc. ==References== <references/> {{Matthew Good (Band)}} [[Category:1997 albums]] [[Category:Matthew Good albums]]
